title: UN must play role to ensure human rights in IIOJK: Bilawal
content:
KARACHI, Aug 05 (APP): Foreign Minister Bilawal Bhutto Zardari on Friday condemned Indian atrocities in Indian Illegally Occupied Jammu and Kashmir (IIOJK) and said that the United Nations (UN) must play its part to get human rights restored in IIOJK.
He said that Indian government thrashed the resolution of UN on IIOJK by changing Article 370 and 35A.
He said that the Indian step had pushed the peace of the region to the quagmire of destruction.
Bilawal said that the IIOK had been deprived of their rights.
He said that all Hurriyat supporters including Yaseen Malik and Mirwaiz Umar Farooq be released.
He also paid homages to shaheed Burhan Wani and all other Kashmiri martyred.
